Title: Big Oil's New Favorite Toy: Supercomputers
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: Oil companies such as BP and Eni are pouring hundreds of millions of dollars into supercomputers, part of a larger digital arms race among energy companies to produce fossil fuels more cheaply and efficiently.

Title: Oil Giant Shell Wants to Sell You Electricity
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: British-Dutch oil-and-gas company Shell is on a spree of small but strategic acquisitions in an area oil firms have long avoided: the power sector.

Title: Costs From Nassar Case Likely to Exceed $500 Million for Michigan State
Author: Melissa Korn
Description: Financial fallout from sexual-abuse allegations against former U.S. national gymnastics team doctor Larry Nassar will likely soar well past half a billion dollars for Michigan State University.

Title: Eni Lifts Dividend After Years of Cuts
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: Italy’s state-backed oil giant Eni is raising its dividend, in a fresh sign that the international energy industry is bouncing back from a three-year downturn.

Title: Getting the 'Oil' Out: Norway's Statoil Rebrands
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: Norway’s state-backed oil company Statoil is changing its name to Equinor, a move intended to show it is serious about a strategic shift to renewable-energy production.

Title: Top Chinese Oilman Is Struck Down and a $9 Billion Russian Deal Is at Risk
Author: Wall Street Journal
Description: Ye Jianming, who has ties to China’s military intelligence, shot from obscurity to spearhead multi-billion-dollar deals with leaders in Africa, Europe and Russia that won the blessing of President Xi Jinping.

Title: Mediterranean Gas Bounty Suddenly Seems Within Big Oil's Reach
Author: Rory Jones
Description: Big oil companies are moving into Mediterranean waters off Israel, Lebanon and Egypt after years of U.S. diplomacy helped ease a political logjam around giant Middle Eastern natural-gas discoveries.

Title: GM CEO Pushes for Renewed Tax Breaks on Electric Vehicles
Author: Mike Colias
Description: General Motors Co. Chief Executive Mary Barra is pressing Washington for an expansion of electric-vehicle tax credits, a plea that would help the company and rivals like Tesla Inc. sell battery-powered cars in an era of cheap gasoline and skepticism about alt…

Title: Iran's Oil Potential Remains Untapped
Author: Benoit Faucon
Description: International oil companies are staying on the sidelines as the Trump administration threatens to rip up the 2016 deal and reimpose oil sanctions lifted in exchange for limits on its atomic-power program.

Title: Oil Man T. Boone Pickens Is Becoming an ETF
Author: Ryan Dezember
Description: T. Boone Pickens--the wildcatter, corporate raider, cattle trader and investor--will become an exchange-traded fund on Wednesday.

Title: Huawei's U.K. Relationship Raises U.S. Concerns
Author: Stu Woo
Description: Huawei Technologies Co., a Chinese maker of smartphones and telecom gear, is seen in Washington as a potential tool of state-sponsored spying, but Britain and several other U.S. allies are embracing Huawei’s technology.

Title: America's Emerging Petro Economy Flips the Impact of Oil
Author: Greg Ip
Description: The effect of oil prices on the U.S. economy used to be straightforward: Higher was bad. Yet between 2014 and early 2016, as oil collapsed, growth slowed sharply. Since then oil has doubled, yet the economy has accelerated.

Title: Big Oil Is Rewarding Investors Again
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: Big dividends and share buybacks are making a comeback in the oil industry amid a fragile market recovery, with French oil giant Total the latest company to signal growing confidence in the industry.

Title: BP Posts First Quarterly Loss in More Than a Year
Author: Sarah Kent

Title: Big Oil Returns to Drilling---but on a Budget
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: Big oil companies are resuming ambitious offshore projects, but this time they are keeping spending in check, as investors urge them to avoid a repeat of their overspending in the last oil rally.

Author: Ryan Dezember
Description: Misery over real estate hasn’t ended—2.5 million homes are still worth less than their mortgages. Here’s the story of one Wall Street Journal reporter’s upside-down American dream.

Author: Christopher Alessi
Description: Saudi Arabia’s state oil company is building an oil-refining empire, a major shift for the world’s No. 1 crude producer as it tries to shore up its balance sheet ahead of the world’s biggest-ever IPO and make up for income lost to OPEC production cuts.

Author: Anatoly Kurmanaev
Description: Oil from Lake Maracaibo transformed Venezuela into the world’s biggest oil exporter, but output has plummeted, oil equipment is idle and rusting and once-flush workers are going hungry and must deal with failing equipment and piracy.

Title: BP Returns to a Northern Iraq Now Free of Islamic State
Author: Benoit Faucon
Description: BP will return to northern Iraq for the first time since Islamic State swept through the region three years ago, potentially heralding a new era of stability in one of the world’s most dangerous energy-production provinces.

Title: BP to Book $1.7 Billion Charge for Deepwater Horizon Claims
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: BP’s fourth-quarter profits are under threat from multibillion-dollar charges related to the company’s fatal blowout in the Gulf of Mexico eight years ago and changes to the U.S. corporate tax rate.

Title: Shell Bids a Long Goodbye to Middle Eastern Oil
Author: Sarah Kent
Description: Royal Dutch Shell is giving up on its last oil fields in Iraq, leaving the world’s second-biggest oil company with a dwindling footprint in the Middle East—a region it helped build into a petroleum powerhouse.

Title: T. Boone Pickens Calls It Quits on Energy Trading...
Author: Alison Sider
Description: The Oklahoma oilman and investment manager is closing the energy-focused hedge fund he has run for the last two decades after struggles with his health and returns, saying trading no longer intrigues him as it once did.

Title: New York City Sues Oil Companies in Climate Change Lawsuit
Author: Corinne Ramey
Description: New York City filed a lawsuit against five major oil companies, asking for billions of dollars to protect the city from climate change.
